# FReD

The goal of the FReD package is to provide various interfaces to the
FORRT Replication Database. The package includes two shiny apps - the
FReD Explorer and the FReD Annotator - as well as functions to directly
access and analyse the dataset.

## FReD Explorer

The FReD Explorer allows users to explore the dataset, and to assess
replicability and effect sizes of the included studies based on various
filters. It primarily serves as a gateway to meta-science. You can
access the FReD Explorer
[online](https://forrt-replications.shinyapps.io/fred_explorer/) or by
calling
[`run_explorer()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/run_explorer.md) in
your R console after you have loaded the package.

## FReD Annotator

The FReD Annotator allows users to annotate lists of articles
(e.g.Â reading lists for classes, or reference lists for draft articles)
with any replication findings. This is intended to make it easier to use
replications in teaching and research, and to thus ensure that claims
are based on the best available evidence. You can access the FReD
Annotator
[online](https://forrt-replications.shinyapps.io/fred_annotator/) or by
calling
[`run_annotator()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/run_annotator.md) in
your R console after you have loaded the package.

## Installation

You can install the development version of FReD like so:

``` r
devtools::install_github("forrtproject/FReD")
```

## Launching the apps

``` r
library(FReD)
run_explorer()
run_annotator()
```

## Accessing the data

To load the dataset and prepare it for analyses, you can use the
following code:

``` r
library(FReD)
load_fred_data()
```

# Package index

## All functions

- [`add_common_effect_sizes()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/add_common_effect_sizes.md)
  : Add common effect size columns to FReD dataset
- [`add_replication_power()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/add_replication_power.md)
  : Add power
- [`add_sampling_variances()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/add_sampling_variances.md)
  : Add confidence intervals
- [`align_effect_direction()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/align_effect_direction.md)
  : Align effect direction
- [`assess_replication_outcome()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/assess_replication_outcome.md)
  : Assess Replication Outcomes Based on Various Criteria
- [`calculate_prediction_interval()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/calculate_prediction_interval.md)
  : Calculate Prediction Interval for a Correlation Coefficient
- [`clean_variables()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/clean_variables.md)
  : Clean variables Perform some specific operations (e.g., recoding
  some NA as "") required to get the Shiny apps to work. This may be a
  temporary solution, as much of it should likely be handled through
  validation in the data sheet, and at import time.
- [`code_replication_outcomes()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/code_replication_outcomes.md)
  : Code replication outcomes
- [`coerce_to_numeric()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/coerce_to_numeric.md)
  : Coerce specified variables to numeric and identify problematic
  values
- [`convert_effect_sizes()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/convert_effect_sizes.md)
  : Convert effect sizes to a common metric (Pearson's r)
- [`create_citation()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/create_citation.md)
  : Create FReD dataset citation
- [`get_dataset_changelog()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/get_dataset_changelog.md)
  : Get the dataset changelog from OSF
- [`get_last_modified()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/get_last_modified.md)
  : Get the date of last modification
- [`load_fred_data()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/load_fred_data.md)
  : Load the FReD dataset
- [`load_variable_descriptions()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/load_variable_descriptions.md)
  : Load variable descriptions
- [`print(`*`<fred_equivalence_test_result>`*`)`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/print.fred_equivalence_test_result.md)
  : Print Method for Equivalence Test Result
- [`read_fred()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/read_fred.md) : Read
  the FReD dataset
- [`run_annotator()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/run_annotator.md)
  : Run the Replication Annotator
- [`run_app()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/run_app.md) : Run a
  shiny app within the package - potentially as an RStudio job
- [`run_explorer()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/run_explorer.md) :
  Run the Replication Explorer
- [`setting-parameters`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/setting-parameters.md)
  : Setting Parameters for the FReD Package
- [`test_equivalence_r()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/test_equivalence_r.md)
  : Equivalence Test for a Correlation
- [`update_offline_data()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/update_offline_data.md)
  : Update inbuilt data
- [`use_FReD_offline()`](http://forrt.org/FReD/reference/use_FReD_offline.md)
  : Set FReD to work offline (or back to online)

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [Assessing replication
  success](http://forrt.org/FReD/articles/success_criteria.md):
